intro: Neobuxbaumia multiareolata, commonly known as the Arizona holly, is a flowering plant native to the Sonoran Desert. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with glossy, elliptical leaves that have a distinct waxy coating. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers in clusters during the spring, which are followed by red, fleshy fruits. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it well-suited to arid and semi-arid environments. Neobuxbaumia multiareolata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
